    • Field Summary

      static int DURATION_FAST
      The fastest speed used for a regular animation.
      static int DURATION_NORMAL
      Typical duration for animations in the Sense app.
      static int DURATION_SLOW
      The slowest speed used for a regular animation.
      static int DURATION_VERY_FAST
      For animations that will be run in the middle of a user interaction where just snapping an element off the screen would look bad.
      static android.view.animation.Interpolator INTERPOLATOR_DEFAULT
      The default interpolator used by the animation package.

    • Field Detail

      • DURATION_VERY_FAST

        public static final int DURATION_VERY_FAST
        For animations that will be run in the middle of a user interaction where just snapping an element off the screen would look bad.

        Also available as @integer/anime_duration_very_fast.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DURATION_FAST

        public static final int DURATION_FAST
        The fastest speed used for a regular animation.

        Also available as @integer/anime_duration_fast.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DURATION_SLOW

        public static final int DURATION_SLOW
        The slowest speed used for a regular animation.

        Also available as @integer/anime_duration_slow.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DURATION_NORMAL

        public static final int DURATION_NORMAL
        Typical duration for animations in the Sense app. The original duration constant used by iOS before version 7.

        Also available as @integer/anime_duration_normal.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INTERPOLATOR_DEFAULT

        public static final android.view.animation.Interpolator INTERPOLATOR_DEFAULT
        The default interpolator used by the animation package.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateDuration

        public static long calculateDuration(float velocity,
                                     float area)
        Calculate an animation duration for a given velocity over a given range of pixels.
        Parameters:
        velocity - The velocity. Pixels/ms
        area - The area the movement was contained within. Pixels.
        Returns:
        A duration for use with an Animator.

      • interpolateFloats

        public static float interpolateFloats(float fraction,
                                      float start,
                                      float end)
        Same as the logic from FloatEvaluator without the overhead of auto-boxing operations.
        Parameters:
        fraction - The fraction from the starting to the ending values.
        start - The start value.
        end - The end value.
        Returns:
        A linear interpolation between the start and end values, given the fraction parameter.

      • interpolateColors

        public static int interpolateColors(float fraction,
                                    int startColor,
                                    int endColor)
        Same as the logic from ArgbEvaluator without the costs of auto-boxing associated with it.
        Parameters:
        fraction - The fraction from the starting to the ending colors.
        startColor - The start color.
        endColor - The end color.
        Returns:
        A linear interpolation between the start and end colors, given the fraction parameter.

      • cancelAll

        public static void cancelAll(android.view.View... forViews)
        Stops any running animation on a given array of views.

        If your view implements custom animations outside of View.animate(), and MultiAnimator, and you want to support this method, you should override View.clearAnimation().

        Parameters:
        forViews - The views to cancel running animations on.

      • isAnimating

        public static boolean isAnimating(android.view.View view)
        Returns whether or not a given view is known to be animating.
        Parameters:
        view - The view to find the animating status for.
        Returns:
        true if the view is animating; false otherwise.

      • addAnimatingView

        public static void addAnimatingView(android.view.View view)
        Adds a view to the currently animating set.
        Parameters:
        view - The view that is animating.

      • removeAnimatingView

        public static void removeAnimatingView(android.view.View view)
        Removes a view from the currently animating set.
        Parameters:
        view - The view that was animating.
